choices.D: It terminates the user session or connection of the attacker
choices.B: It reflects the traffic back to the sender
choices.A: It reconfigures a device to block the traffic

questions.question_text: Which two actions does an IPS perform? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: D,E more likely but not sure....

When packets in a session match a signature, Cisco IOS IPS can take any of the following actions, as appropriate:•Send an alarm to a syslog server or a centralized management interface.•Drop the packet.•Reset the connection.•Deny traffic from the source IP address of the attacker for a specified amount of time.•Deny traffic on the connection for which the signature was seen for a specified amount of time.
How an ips can configures devices?
I think that the correct answers are D and E
blended attack mean more than one mean of propagating or performing attack so that the answer is A & D

comments.content:
may be right answer D,E. 
it's from wiki 
A blended threat (also known as a blended attack[1]) is a software exploit which in turn involves a combination of attacks against different vulnerabilities. For example, many worm, a trojan horse and a computer virus exploit multiple techniques to attack and propagate. It is a kind of computer threat.

misclick))
may be right answer B,E.

questions.question_text: Which two characteristics represent a blended threat? (Choose two.)
Which statement represents a difference between an access list on an ASA versus an access list on a router?

choices.A: The ASA does not support standard access lists
choices.C: The ASA does not support numbered access lists
choices.D: The ASA does not support extended access lists
choices.B: The ASA does not ever use a wildcard mask

discussion.content:
ASA does use standard ACLs: “Standard ACLs identify the destination IP addresses of OSPF routes and can be used in a route map for OSPF redistribution. Standard ACLs cannot be applied to interfaces to control traffic. ”

B is the correct answer. There are no wildcard masks on an ASA.
B is the correct answer. I would select this with no issues
B. The ASA does not ever use a wildcard mask
There are no wildcard masks on an ASA

questions.question_text: Which two protocols enable Cisco Configuration Professional to pull IPS alerts from a Cisco ISR router? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
SDEE and HTTPS

The explaination in brief is, in the “Implementing Cisco IOS Network Security (IINS): (CCNA Security exam 640-553) (Authorized Self-Study Guide)” book of Cisco Press, it is written as a note “to “PULL” IPS alerts from the router, SDM use SDEE and NOT Syslog, and to enable SDEE you have to enable HTTP or HTTPS on the router.

Again, it is a tricky question, but think good, and read carefully the question and think about the word “PULL”, you will figure out that the answer is: SDEE and HTTPS.
I confirm the answers A and B, I seem CCNA Security curriculum offline and to the section 5.2.5 Managing and Monitoring IPS.
Correct answer: A and B (Syslogs and SDEE)

choices.E: the xmodem privilege EXEC mode command to recover the Cisco IOS image

questions.question_text: What will be disabled as a result of the no service password-recovery command?

discussion.content:
The no service password-recovery command disable ROMMON mode so that the config registers can not be changed. Answer is correct. 
B
A. changes to the config-register setting
